TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit FormattableFlags extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: FormattableFlags are used as a parameter to and change the output format in Formattables.

remarks.para: FormattableFlags are used as a parameter to and change the output format in Formattables. The validation and interpretation of the flags must be done by the implementations.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(native int javaReference, valuetype Android.Runtime.JniHandleOwnership transfer) cil managed

Docs.param: A containing a Java Native Interface (JNI) object reference.
Docs.summary: A constructor used when creating managed representations of JNI objects; called by the runtime.

remarks.para: This constructor is invoked by the runtime infrastructure () to create a new managed representation for a Java Native Interface object.
The constructor will initializes the property of the new instance using and .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Java.Util.FormatFlags Alternate = (4)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Java.Util.FormatFlags enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: Denotes the output is to be formatted in an alternate form.

remarks.para:
Denotes the output is to be formatted in an alternate form. The definition of the alternate form is determined by the Formattable.
This flag corresponds to '#' ('#') in the format specifier.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Java.Util.FormatFlags LeftJustify = (1)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Java.Util.FormatFlags enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: Denotes the output is to be left-justified.

remarks.para:
Denotes the output is to be left-justified. In order to fill the minimum width requirement, spaces(' ') will be appended at the end of the specified output element. If no such flag is set, the output is right-justified.
The flag corresponds to '-' ('-') in the format specifier.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Java.Util.FormatFlags Uppercase = (2)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Java.Util.FormatFlags enum directly instead of this field.")

Docs.summary: Denotes the output is to be converted to upper case in the way the locale parameter of Formatter.formatTo() requires.

remarks.para:
Denotes the output is to be converted to upper case in the way the locale parameter of Formatter.formatTo() requires. The output has the same effect as String.toUpperCase(java.util.Locale).
This flag corresponds to '^' ('^') in the format specifier.
